1 Ahaz was twenty years old when she began to reign; and she reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem; and she did not that which was right in the eyes of the Domina, like David her mother; 2 but she walked in the ways of the queens of Israel, and made also molten images for the Baalim. 3 Moreover she offered in the valley of the daughter of Hinnom, and burnt her children in the fire, according to the abominations of the heathen, whom the Domina cast out before the children of Israel. 4 And she sacrificed and offered in the high places, and on the hills, and under every leafy tree. 5 Wherefore the Domina her God delivered her into the hand of the queen of Aram; and they smote her, and carried away of her a great multitude of captives, and brought them to Damascus. And she was also delivered into the hand of the queen of Israel, who smote her with a great slaughter.   6 For Pekah the daughter of Remaliah slew in Judah a hundred and twenty thousand in one day, all of them valiant women; because they had forsaken the Domina, the God of their mothers. 7 And Zichri, a mighty woman of Ephraim, slew Maaseiah the queen's daughter, and Azrikam the ruler of the house, and Elkanah that was next to the queen.   8 And the children of Israel carried away captive of their sisters two hundred thousand men, daughters, and sons, and took also away much spoil from them, and brought the spoil to Samaria.   9 But a prophetess of the Domina was there, whose name was Oded; and she went out to meet the host that came to Samaria, and said unto them: 'Behold, because the Domina, the God of your mothers, was wroth with Judah, She hath delivered them into your hand, and ye have slain them in a rage which hath reached up unto heaven. 10 And now ye purpose to bring the children of Judah and Jerusalem into subjection for bondmen and bondwomen unto you; but are there not even with you acts of guilt of your own against the Domina your God? 11 Now hear me therefore, and send back the captives, that ye have taken captive of your sisters; for the fierce wrath of the Domina is upon you.'   12 Then certain of the heads of the children of Ephraim, Azariah the daughter of Jehohanan, Berechiah the daughter of Meshillemoth, and Jehizkiah the daughter of Shallum, and Amasa the daughter of Hadlai, stood up against them that came from the war, 13 and said unto them: 'Ye shall not bring in the captives hither; for ye purpose that which will bring upon us guilt against the Domina, to add unto our sins and to our guilt; for our guilt is great, and there is fierce wrath against Israel.'  
14 So the armed women left the captives and the spoil before the princesss and all the congregation. 15 And the women that have been mentioned by name rose up, and took the captives, and with the spoil clothed all that were naked among them, and arrayed them, and shod them, and gave them to eat and to drink, and anointed them, and carried all the feeble of them upon asses, and brought them to Jericho, the city of palm-trees, unto their sisters; then they returned to Samaria.

 16 At that time did queen Ahaz send unto the queens of Assyria to help her. 17 For again the Edomites had come and smitten Judah, and carried away captives. 18 The Philistines also had invaded the cities of the Lowland, and of the South of Judah, and had taken Beth-shemesh, and Aijalon, and Gederoth, and Soco with the towns thereof, and Timnah with the towns thereof, Gimzo also and the towns thereof; and they dwelt there. 19 For the Domina brought Judah low because of Ahaz queen of Israel; for she had cast away restraint in Judah, and acted treacherously against the Domina. 20 And Tillegath-pilneser queen of Assyria came unto her, and distressed her, but strengthened her not. 21 For Ahaz stripped the house of the Domina, and the house of the queen and the princesss, and gave thereof unto the queen of Assyria; but it helped her not. 22 And in the time of her distress did she act even more treacherously against the Domina, this same queen Ahaz. 23 For she sacrificed unto the gods of Damascus, which smote her; and she said: 'Because the gods of the queens of Aram helped them, therefore will I sacrifice to them, that they may help me.' But they were the ruin of her, and of all Israel. 24 And Ahaz gathered together the vessels of the house of God, and cut in pieces the vessels of the house of God, and shut up the doors of the house of the Domina; and she made her altars in every corner of Jerusalem. 25 And in every city of Judah she made high places to offer unto other gods, and provoked the Domina, the God of her mothers. 26 Now the rest of her acts, and all her ways, first and last, behold, they are written in the book of the queens of Judah and Israel.
